## Episode Overview

<p><strong>From death records to predictive algorithms.</strong></p><p>This episode traces 400 years of health intelligence—from counting who died to forecasting what comes next.</p><p>We move from John Graunt’s 17th-century Bills of Mortality, through modern burden-of-disease metrics like DALYs, to today’s machine-learning models that learn from data to anticipate outbreaks and inform prevention.</p>


## Key Topics Discussed

- Data-driven insights
- Health metrics analysis
- Innovative approaches to public health
